author: Firoz Rozindar
text:
He killed the19-year-old toclaim Rs. 30 crorein insurance

Greed for money led to the murder recently of a 19-year-old migrant labourer from Vijayapura district in Maharashtra by a businessman, who tried to make a false insurance claim of Rs. 30 crore by showing the labourer’s body as his own.

According to the police, Ramesh Naik from Nagabenal village in Vijayapura district, was killed a month ago by Amol Pawar and his brother Vinayak.

The police said that Amol had insured himself with a private agency for Rs. 30 crore. Following huge loss in business, the debt-ridden Amol, along with his brother, planned a conspiracy to claim the insurance money.

The siblings befriended Ramesh, who was working in Gandhinglaj town of Kolhapur district, and offered him work for better wage.

The police said that after taking Ramesh with them, the brothers killed him and disfigured his face. Later, Amol placed some of his personal documents on Ramesh’s body and replaced his clothes too to give a feeling that the murder was for gain.

During their investigation before releasing the money, the insurance agency got suspicious as the identification marks given by Amol while applying for insurance did not match with the body.

Later, the agency called the police for further investigation, which unearthed the conspiracy. The police have arrested the accused and investigation is under way.

Meanwhile, Ramesh’s father Krishnappa Naik said the police have not handed over the body yet. He said that Ramesh had gone to Kolhapur in November last year, and the murder took place on February 28.
title: Businessman held on charge of killing labourer in Karnataka
